page.title: 13THE CHURCH OF ST. BUDOC
page.content: Our Church dates from the thirteenth century and is of great historical interest. The legend of St. Budoc tells of an unusual journey before the foundation of a settlement here: 'Azenor was the only daughter of the widowed King of Brest.Having no male heir, the king married again.His new wife was jealous of her step-daughter. When Azenor married the Count of Goello and became pregnant the step- mother arranged to have her convicted of adultery.Azenor was cast into the sea in a barrel which washed up on the coast of Ireland where monks carefully opened it to reveal Azenor and her baby, born during the journey.The Abbot promised mother and baby shelter.The boy became a monk and later an Abbot.He founded a settlement here.'
